thread.title: Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses
thread.title_full: Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses

author: KEN THOMAS and CATHERINE LUCEY
title: Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses
text:
Charlie Neibergall Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses 
Democratic presidential candidate Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., speaks during the Iowa Democratic Party's Jefferson-Jackson Dinner, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Des Moines, Iowa. (AP Photo/Charlie Neibergall) Charlie Neibergall Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses 
Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton speaks during the Iowa Democratic Party's Jefferson-Jackson fundraising dinner, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Des Moines, Iowa. (AP Photo/Charlie Neibergall) Charlie Neibergall Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses 
Former President Bill Clinton and his wife, Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton, wave to supporters after the Iowa Democratic Party's Jefferson-Jackson fundraising dinner, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Des Moines, Iowa. (AP Photo/Charlie Neibergall) Charlie Neibergall Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses 
Democratic presidential candidate and former Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley speaks during the Iowa Democratic Party's Jefferson-Jackson fundraising dinner, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Des Moines, Iowa. (AP Photo/Charlie Neibergall) Charlie Neibergall Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses 
Singer Katy Perry reacts as Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton is introduced to speak at the Iowa Democratic Party's Jefferson-Jackson Dinner, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Des Moines, Iowa. (AP Photo/Charlie Neibergall) Charlie Neibergall Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses 
Reid Sheldahl, of Des Moines, Iowa, raises his arms as Democratic presidential candidate Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., speaks during the Iowa Democratic Party's Jefferson-Jackson fundraising dinner, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Des Moines, Iowa. (AP Photo/Charlie Neibergall) Charlie Neibergall Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses 
Democratic presidential candidate Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., walks off stage after speaking during the Iowa Democratic Party's Jefferson-Jackson fundraising dinner, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Des Moines, Iowa. (AP Photo/Charlie Neibergall) Charlie Neibergall Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses 
Democratic presidential candidate and former Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley listens as he is introduced to speak during the Iowa Democratic Party's Jefferson-Jackson fundraising dinner, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Des Moines, Iowa. (AP Photo/Charlie Neibergall) Charlie Neibergall The Latest: Clinton has high praise for Biden now 
Democratic presidential candidate Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., speaks during the Iowa Democratic Party's Jefferson-Jackson Dinner, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Des Moines, Iowa. (AP Photo/Charlie Neibergall) Posted: Sunday, October 25, 2015 5:39 am Sanders, Clinton set tone for leadoff presidential caucuses Associated Press | 
DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) — Bernie Sanders sharpened the contrast with Hillary Rodham Clinton on a bevy of liberal causes on Saturday, casting himself as a principled progressive before thousands of Iowa Democrats in an appearance that could set the tone for the leadoff presidential caucuses in February.
